channel.title: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?
channel.description: I want to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player. Would this be client or server side.

item.title: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

Wtf do u people care all i need is help, and if you must know, your only maxed in combat stats. You must skill for the rest of the stats.
Now could i have some help??

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

Park.

Do you wont this only to happen in a certain spot? Because taking away people seeing the level will cause a lot of trouble. If your making it where they can’t see it in a certain spot, then that is more sane.

item.title: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?
item.dc:creator: @Busta_Blader Busta Blader
item.description:
@Busta_Blader wrote:

[quote=“Zombiedevice, post:11, topic:196871”][quote author=i defin3 pk link=topic=261527.msg2167067#msg2167067 date=1207542154]

Heres my proof… Maybe we both right?

You can make it client side because on Silabsoft client it has the id’s next to the items and on other clients it doesn’t and you can do the same with their combat levels too noobs. So you can make it client and server side by the looks of it…
[/quote]but it wont work
if you add it to your client and click demote nothing will happen because it depends weather the server will support it.

I agree.

Umm yes it does i have taken away stuff from there like id’s and such and you can do same with levels.

I don’t know if it is client side really. I know that it is server side 100%. It may be both.[/quote]What if it is serverside and client side? Lets get on a server and see you do it server side, If that works I’ll stop arguing if not ill show u client side.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice

[quote=“i defin3 pk, post:1, topic:196879”][quote author=Busta Blader link=topic=261527.msg2167061#msg2167061 date=1207542085]
Heres my proof… Maybe we both right?

You can make it client side because on Silabsoft client it has the id’s next to the items and on other clients it doesn’t and you can do the same with their combat levels too noobs. So you can make it client and server side by the looks of it…
[/quote]but it wont work
if you add it to your client and click demote nothing will happen because it depends weather the server will support it.[/quote]

I agree.

Busta Blader:

Umm yes it does i have taken away stuff from there like id’s and such and you can do same with levels.

I don’t know if it is client side really. I know that it is server side 100%. It may be both.

item.source: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?

item.title: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?
item.dc:creator: @Mary_Jane Mary|Jane
item.description:
@Mary_Jane wrote:

[quote=“Zombiedevice, post:6, topic:196871”]It is server side. And I have your proof that it is server side.

if(playerRights <= 2)
		{
		outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
		outStream.writeByteC(2);		// command slot
		outStream.writeByteA(0);		// 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
		outStream.writeString("Follow");
		outStream.endFrameVarSize();
		}

This is in your class client. Basically it says if your playerRights is 2, then it will show in one of the right clicking slots “follow.” Same thing with combat level.[/quote]

Indeed, +1.

Read full topic
item.source: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?

item.title: Is it possible to take away the combat level when right clicking on a player?
item.dc:creator: @Zombiedevice Zombiedevice
item.description:
@Zombiedevice wrote:

It is server side. And I have your proof that it is server side.

if(playerRights <= 2)
		{
		outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
		outStream.writeByteC(2);		// command slot
		outStream.writeByteA(0);		// 0 or 1; 1 if command should be placed on top in context menu
		outStream.writeString("Follow");
		outStream.endFrameVarSize();
		}

This is in your class client. Basically it says if your playerRights is 2, then it will show in one of the right clicking slots “follow.” Same thing with combat level.

Read full topic
